intro: Silene microsperma, commonly known as the small-seeded catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Silene microsperma is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions.
